content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
No new structures have been successfully constructed on the map. The agent made several attempts to place a Lab at Position(x=0.5, y=2.5) for supplying Automation Science Packs, but all placement efforts failed due to missing inventory items and incomplete resource chains. Although references were made to a furnace at Position(x=5.0, y=5.0) for smelting iron plates and a copper furnace at Position(x=-27.0, y=-60.0) for copper plate production, these were retrieved for processing and do not represent new constructions initiated by the agent.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• API Usage for Entity Retrieval:
  – When invoking get_entities, use only the supported parameters. Avoid including unsupported keyword arguments (such as “radius”) or an incorrect count of positional arguments.

• Null Iteration Handling:
  – Always check that functions returning lists of entities do not yield None before iterating. Use a fallback (for example, an empty list) to safely process results.

• Structure Placement Verification:
  – Ensure that the required item (e.g., Lab) is available in the inventory before attempting placement. Confirm that the target tile is valid and unoccupied to prevent placement errors.

• Crafting Prerequisite Management:
  – Verify that all necessary sub-ingredients for complex items, such as Labs, are available. Address shortages in components like iron-gear-wheels, copper-cables, and electronic-circuits by managing upstream production steps effectively.
